it.polimi.se2018.controller

Class SinglePlayerController

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2018.controller.Controller
      • it.polimi.se2018.controller.SinglePlayerController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observer<ViewMessage>

    public class SinglePlayerController
extends Controller
    This class extends the abstract Controller class and implements those behaviors that are different in Single Player and MultiPlayer mode: the main differences are in the management of the connection/reconnection of the Player, in the game's setting up, in the ToolCard's usage and in the end game scoring.
    Author:
    giorgiolabate

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SinglePlayerController(Game game, int turnDuration, int timeOut)
      Creates a new controller for the Single Player mode associated to the specified game instance.

      This method receives a message of DISCONNECT_PLAYER and it starts disconnectedTimer and maintains the actual Game instance still available for timeout(ms)*1000 seconds, then it destroys it.

      This method tells the number of dice that have to be drafted: it is useful in the setting up of each new Round.

      This method receives a message of RECONNECT_PLAYER and it interrupts the disconnectedTimer because the Player has reconnected within the established period of time.

      Allows to register custom action handlers.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SinglePlayerController

        public SinglePlayerController(Game game,
                              int turnDuration,
                              int timeOut)
        Creates a new controller for the Single Player mode associated to the specified game instance.
        Parameters:
        game - The game that has to be bound to the controller.
        turnDuration - The time that the player have to consume his turn.
        timeOut - Period that has to be waited keeping the current Game still valid and after which the Game has to be deleted.

    • Method Detail

      • registerActions

        protected void registerActions(java.util.Map<Action,java.util.function.Consumer<ViewMessage>> actions)
        Allows to register custom action handlers. It registers all the actions common to both SinglePlayer mode and multiPlayer and adds the typical SinglePlayer mode's actions.
        Specified by:
        registerActions in class Controller
        Parameters:
        actions - The map containing the name-handler pairs.

      • registerPlayer

        protected void registerPlayer(ViewMessage message)
        Register the new player in the Game. After the registration, it selects the View asking the player the difficulty he wishes to play.
        Specified by:
        registerPlayer in class Controller
        Parameters:
        message - The message generated by the view that contains the Player's name.

      • endGame

        protected void endGame(ViewMessage message)
        Handles the end of the game. When the game ends, the DraftPool is cleaned and the view is informed to display the selection between the two PrivateObjectiveCard for the Player. The end game scoring and the management of the scoreBoard are delegated to the selectPrivateObjective method: they require the choice of the PrivateObjectiveCard by the Player to ensure a correct execution.
        Specified by:
        endGame in class Controller
        Parameters:
        message - The event generated by the View that encapsulates the necessary data for the operation.

      • calculateScores

        protected void calculateScores()
        Calculate the scores of the two players: the user and the RoundTrack. It is calculated following the game's rules, the only difference in SinglePlayer mode is that the Player loses 3 point (in stead of 1) for each open space on his grid.
        Specified by:
        calculateScores in class Controller

      • canUseToolCard

        protected boolean canUseToolCard(ViewMessage message,
                                 ToolCard toolCard)
        This method is used by the activateToolCard to verify that the usage of the ToolCard indicated in message is allowed. The toolCard won't be available in solo mode in various situations: it is not the Turn of the Player who made the request; the indicated Die's Colour in the DraftPool doesn't match the ToolCard's Colour; the ToolCard has been already used; the ToolCard doesn't exists.
        Specified by:
        canUseToolCard in class Controller
        Parameters:
        message - The event generated by the View that encapsulates the necessary data for the operation (name of the ToolCard and index of the Die in the DraftPool that Player wishes to spend for the action).
        toolCard - the ToolCard to use.
        Returns:
        true if it is possible to use the ToolCard indicated in the message, false otherwise.

      • displayGame

        protected void displayGame(ViewMessage message)
        Show the correct view for Single Player mode.
        Specified by:
        displayGame in class Controller
        Parameters:
        message - The message sent by the view.

      • getDraftAmount

        protected int getDraftAmount()
        This method tells the number of dice that have to be drafted: it is useful in the setting up of each new Round.
        Specified by:
        getDraftAmount in class Controller
        Returns:
        the number of dice that has to be drafted at the beginning of each Round: in single Player mode they are always 4.

      • consumeResources

        protected void consumeResources(ViewMessage message)
        This method eliminates the selected Die for the ToolCard's usage that is associated to the actual Turn.
        Specified by:
        consumeResources in class Controller
        Parameters:
        message - The message sent by the view.

      • disconnectPlayer

        protected void disconnectPlayer(ViewMessage message)
        This method receives a message of DISCONNECT_PLAYER and it starts disconnectedTimer and maintains the actual Game instance still available for timeout(ms)*1000 seconds, then it destroys it.
        Specified by:
        disconnectPlayer in class Controller
        Parameters:

      • reconnectPlayer

        protected void reconnectPlayer(ViewMessage message)
        This method receives a message of RECONNECT_PLAYER and it interrupts the disconnectedTimer because the Player has reconnected within the established period of time.
        Specified by:
        reconnectPlayer in class Controller
        Parameters:
        message - The message generated by the view.
